152.sentence: I've yet to find the limitation for this Hitachi (my only Hitachi tool, by the way) and quite frankly, I don't know that I have the muscle to push this machine any harder.

153.sentence: Bottom line is that at $160, this is an absolute steal.

154.sentence: I've got a buddy who's trying to offload his almost new $300 Speedmatic because he saw what this router can do.

155.sentence: It is without even a slight doubt, my new favorite.

156.sentence: The Hitachi M12V is a dream to work with, smooth starts, adjustable speeds, micro-adjustable depth, and plenty of power to spare.

157.sentence: I couldn't believe what I had been missing.

158.sentence: If you're looking for a 3hp plunge router, the Hitachi M12V is your best bet to stretch your equipment budget.

159.sentence: I'll be getting a second one for my router table!

160.sentence: I have been impressed with the power of the Hitachi M12V.

161.sentence: It doesn't bog down under load.

163.sentence: I use it on a router table, and it is works well.

164.sentence: The major reasons I didn't give it a five are:  One, I didn't think the fine adjustment worked well.

165.sentence: I replaced it with a Router Raizer and it works much better.

166.sentence: Two, the single wrench just doesn't work well.

167.sentence: The sliding latch is does not stay in place.

168.sentence: Other than this, I am very pleased with the router and would buy it again.

172.sentence: The fine adustment knob which came with the router was very difficult to use on a router table.

173.sentence: Finally, I gave up and I purchased a Router Razier.

174.sentence: I am seriously considering purchasing another wrench and just not using the "sliding wrench" which comes on the router.
